identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of 2 Doses of MAP0010 in Asthmatic Children
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-blind, Active-controlled, Phase 3 Extension Study Investigating the Safety and Efficacy Over 40 Weeks of 2 Doses of MAP0010 in Asthmatic Children (12 Months to 8 Years Old at the Time of Enrollment Into the MAP0010-CL-P301 Study)

collaborators.name: MAP Pharmaceuticals, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of Allergan

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to examine the safety of two doses of MAP0010 in asthmatic children, 12 months to 8 years of age, over a 40-week period.

armGroups.label: 0.135mg MAP0010
armGroups.description: 0.135mg MAP0010 (unit dose budesonide) delivered by nebulization twice daily for 40 weeks

armGroups.label: 0.25mg MAP0010
armGroups.description: 0.25mg MAP0010 (unit dose budesonide) delivered by nebulization twice daily for 40 weeks

interventions.name: 0.135mg MAP0010
interventions.description: 0.135mg MAP0010 (unit dose budesonide) delivered by nebulization twice daily for 40 weeks

interventions.name: 0.25mg MAP0010
interventions.description: 0.25mg MAP0010 (unit dose budesonide) delivered by nebulization twice daily for 40 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Patients With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events Related to Study Drug
primaryOutcomes.description: A treatment emergent adverse event is one with a start date on or after the date of first administration of the study drug during the study.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Patients Reporting at Least One Treatment Emergent Adverse Event Leading to Study Termination
primaryOutcomes.description: A treatment emergent adverse event is one with a start date on or after the date of first administration of the study drug during the study.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Completed 12 weeks of treatment in the MAP0010-CL-P301 study.
* Patient, parent, and guardian (as appropriate) are willing for child to undergo all study procedures and willing to sign the informed consent and assent, as appropriate.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Less than 80% compliance with either study treatment and/or other study procedures (e.g., completion of symptom e-diary) in the MAP0010-CL-P301 Study.

outcomeMeasures.description: A treatment emergent adverse event is one with a start date on or after the date of first administration of the study drug during the study.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: All patients who received any study drug and who had at least one post safety evaluation were included in the adverse event analysis.

limitationsAndCaveats.description: The study was terminated due to a corporate decision before all subjects had completed the study.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
